Crispy lamb brains, cauliflower pizza and fried artichoke to start. All were good, especially the brains. They resembled sweet breads, but their texture was creamier and richer. We then enjoyed pasta amatricana with freshly made bucatini. Afterwards the braised oxtails with a side of roasted squash. This was the highlight for sure. The oxtails were amazing. So much so, I had to pick them up and gnaw on them to get all the tasty bits. I'm glad we came back and I am looking forward to the next dinner.
author: c.t. d.

description: I couldn't imagine it any better. Whatever was served was nailed, the price worthy of the quality. Cocktails. appetizers, pasta, entree and dessert. I enjoyed it so much they should pay me! It may be the fourth restaurant in the family but it presents a different vibe with different, developed food.
author: Heather P.

description: Really amazing!! The sodas were great. I'm excited to go back and try more of the pasta dished. YUM!!!
author: Joe F.

description: We came here with pretty great expectations as we love delfina and pizzeria delfina. The cocktails were great and really reminded me of Italy. The food was pretty good. The bread/pizza bianco was delicious. Highly recommend the artichoke and the bucatini. The erbette contorni had too much orange and was inedible to me. It was my date's birthday, and I made this a point when I made the reservation, when I confirmed our reservation, and when we walked in, and yet he received no special recognition. Another table got a candle in their dessert and I wondered why we didn't? I guess I'm disappointed because I expected the food and service to be better. I imagine we'll go back for a cocktail and a snack at the bar, but I don't imagine going again for a special occasion.
author: Addie J.

description: The five stars are for the server we had last night.  The wine and the appetizers were excellent, the ox tail I had was very tasty, however it was a little too fatty for me.   The server was very helpful in helping me get other dishes.  I had oxtails before and I don't remember it being as fatty as what I had last night, I think I just had not such a great piece, I'm glad I tried it though.  I really loved the Jewish style artichoke and the salad we had.  The restaurant itself is beautiful and I am enamored with the wood burning grill in the kitchen.
author: Mark G.

description: Seated within 10 minutes of our reservation. Room is lively and fresh, crowd young and buzzy. Waitress friendly and funny, but knows her stuff. Cocktails, waitress-recommended wines and food (intensely flavorful Jewish-style artichoke, smokey grilled steak, thick, chewy spaghetti with fava beans and leaves, snap peas with mint and chocolate cake) all excellent. Very reasonable tab.
author: David H.

description: Top notch all the way!  You'd never think that they'd opened just a short while ago.  Terrific food (it's hard to single out anything, but "cacio e pepe," anyone?), attentive, professional and friendly staff, a great "ambiente" - a fantastic addition even for a spoiled SF foodies. Can't wait to eat there again..
author: Andres W.

description: currently my favorite restaurant in the city....awesome food, great design, nice wine list and impeccable service..  place makes you feel comfortable as well
author: Jason S.

description: Wow.  What a disappointment.  I am shocked at reading all of the other positive reviews from other diners.  I ate here two weeks ago with 3 others.  The service was beyond slow.  We had to flag our waiter down to order cocktails. Then again to order our meal.  I think we sat there for about an hour before ordering... and this was at 9:45pm.  The appetizers took far too long to get to us and they forgot two of them.  Then our appetizer plates sat there so long, I got up to tell the absent waiter (and we also wanted to order another bottle of wine).  He nodded and then proceeded to do nothing.  Our entree plates came and the runners simply pushed aside our appetizer plates with the edges of these plates.  Unbelievable.  The food was mediocre, oversalted and the portions were way too small for what they charge.  Around $28 for my two lamb chops.  After I gave everyone at the table a bite, I had about five bites left for myself.  Ridiculous.  All of my friends had a similar experience, with my entree being the best (and it really was't that great to begin with).  There are too many wonderful restaurants in this City.  It's been a while since I have had such poor service (with the Mission hipster attitude to boot) and lackluster food.  I couldn't take it anymore, so I approached the hostess and asked to speak with the manager.  I will say, he was very, very apologetic and listened to everything I had to say. Unfortunately, it was a little late to make up for the crappy experience.  Maybe I'll give it another try 100 years from now.  I think it will take them that long to get it right.
author: Heather H.
